page.title: 05LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS 1
page.content: The centre of Rickmansworth has been designated as a conservation area and the following are listed buildings:- Moor Park House,entrance gates,Lodge. Church of St. Mary. The Burry (off Church Street). Joan of Arc Convent. Parsonage Farmhouse. The Feathers (public house). Numbers 36,25,27,29,31 Church Street. The Vicarage, Church Street. 72, High Street. Stockers Farmhouse and Granary. Stockers House and Lock Cottage. BASING HOUSE (High Street)_ William Penn, the founder of Pennsylvania lived here for five years after his marriage in 1672. the present house, built in 1740, was a school in 1839. It is now the District Council's Housing and Planning department with unsightly prefabs around the back.
